org.modelio.api.modelio.diagram.tools

Class DefaultBoxTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.modelio.api.modelio.diagram.tools.DefaultDiagramTool
      • org.modelio.api.modelio.diagram.tools.DefaultBoxTool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBoxTool, IDiagramTool
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericBoxTool

    public abstract class DefaultBoxTool
extends DefaultDiagramTool
implements IBoxTool
    Default implementation of a diagram box command.

    In a diagram, graphic boxes are graphic objects that display diagram nodes. For example Packages and Classes are graphic boxes. IBoxCommand is the interface that drives the interaction of creating a box

    The interaction is started when the user clicks on the button in the diagram palette. Once the interaction is started the user can use the mouse to create a new graphic box in the diagram. The acceptElement method is called to know if the element flown over by the mouse is valid for the command. If it is not valid the user cannot finish the interaction. If the element is valid the user can terminates the interaction by either clicking or by pressing the left mouse button doing a drag and drop and releasing the mouse button. Once this is done the actionPerformed is called.

    The actionPerformed does nothing in this default implementation.
    Subclass the DefaultBoxCommand to provide a behavior to the actionPerformed method.

    • Method Detail

      • acceptElement

        public abstract boolean acceptElement(IDiagramHandle diagramHandle,
                                      IDiagramGraphic targetNode)
        This method accept or refuse the interaction in the diagram.

        This method is called until the interaction is validated by the user.
        This default implementation always accept the interaction.

        Specified by:
        acceptElement in interface IBoxTool
        Parameters:
        diagramHandle - the representation of the diagram in which the interaction occurs.
        targetNode - the graphic that is below the mouse pointer.
        Returns:
        an boolean that represents the result of the acceptElement method.

      • actionPerformed

        public abstract void actionPerformed(IDiagramHandle diagramHandle,
                                     IDiagramGraphic parent,
                                     Rectangle rect)
        This method is called when the interaction is validated by the user.

        This default implementation does nothing.

        If the user click or click and drag in a graphic box the parent argument contains the diagram node container corresponding to graphic box. If the user click or click and drag in the diagram background parent is null.

        The rect argument is the rectangle that result from the user interaction with the diagram. This rect should be used to manage the unmasking of the model element in the diagram.

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface IBoxTool
        Parameters:
        diagramHandle - the representation of the diagram where the command has been triggered.
        parent - the graphic parent where the user has clicked.
        rect - the rectangle of the object to create.
        See Also:
        IDiagramHandle.unmask(MObject, int, int)
